meanings.definition: To twist or sprain (a body part)
meanings.sent1: She wricked her ankle while running.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to wrick your wrist when lifting heavy objects.
meanings.sent3: He wricked his back trying to touch his toes.
meanings.sent4: The tree branches wricked in the strong wind.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's movements wricked gracefully across the stage.

meanings.sent1: Her wricked ankle needed ice and rest.
meanings.sent2: The wricked knee made it hard to walk.
meanings.sent3: The wricked finger throbbed with pain.
meanings.sent4: The wricked wrist was wrapped in a bandage.
meanings.sent5: His wricked shoulder ached with every movement.

meanings.definition: Caused to twist or sprain (body part)
meanings.sent1: The sudden movement wricked his neck.
meanings.sent2: The slippery floor wricked her ankle.
meanings.sent3: He wricked his knee trying to catch the ball.
meanings.sent4: The tight shoes wricked her toes.
meanings.sent5: The awkward landing wricked his elbow.
